channel.title: [mysql] AUTO_INCREMENT that auto resets?
channel.description:
As some of you who use mysql may know when using auto_increment in your database it doesn't reset the values once a value has been deleted. For example:
+----+----------+ | 1 | fat | | 2 | cat | | 3 | dog | | 4 | tool | +----+----------+
deleting the entry "dog" and it'll look like
+----+----------+ | 1 | fat | | 2 | cat | | 4 | tool | +----+----------+
with the entry "tool" not reset back to 3.
Does anyone know how to fix this :/?

item.title: [mysql] AUTO_INCREMENT that auto resets?

item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

oh ok, that does make more sense :P. I guess that’s why when you deleted ilyaostr9 his profile comes up as An Error Has Occurred!

item.title: [mysql] AUTO_INCREMENT that auto resets?
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[php]

<?php //$newvalue = the new value.. and edit the database and table. mysql_query("ALTER TABLE `database`.`table` AUTO_INCREMENT = '$newvalue'"); ?>

[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: [mysql] AUTO_INCREMENT that auto resets?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Why is it a problem? You could do it with a big query:

UPDATE tablename SET auto_increment = auto_increment - 1 WHERE auto_increment > auto_increment_where_you_deleted

But for instance on this forum if that happened for deleted members, your memberid would change all the time and mess everything up, topics wouldnt stay the same and would move around. It simply wouldn’t make any sense to do.

Read full topic

item.title: [mysql] AUTO_INCREMENT that auto resets?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You almost certainly don’t want it to. Why would you want it to?

Read full topic
